tasks.name: Prioritize Product Objectives
tasks.description: Choose and prioritize at least 3 focused objectives for the product, with safety being pre-selected.

completeness.description: At least 3 objectives are chosen, including safety.
Objectives are ranked from 1 to 3 in importance.

presentation.description: Objectives are clearly listed with their rankings.

tasks.name: Analyze Objective Relationships
tasks.description: Define how the chosen objectives align or contrast with each other.

completeness.description: All possible pairs of objectives are analyzed.

presentation.description: Relationships are presented in the format: Objective 1 - Objective 2: [++/+/0/-/--]

tasks.name: Objective Comparison
tasks.description: Compare selected objectives to past or existing objectives and think if they are aligned to future trends (e.g. sustainability, climate change).

completeness.description: compare all selected objectives to past or existing objectives and think if they are aligned to future trends (e.g. sustainability, climate change).

presentation.description: highlight the differences and similarities between the selected objectives and past or existing objectives.

tasks.name: Reflect on Objective Impacts
tasks.description: Consider the impact of prioritized objectives on stakeholders, products, and the environment.

completeness.description: Impacts on stakeholders, products, and environment are all addressed.

quality.description: Reflections demonstrate the impact of the objective on stakeholder's needs and satisfaction, the quality of the product safety, and the short and long term effects on the environment.

presentation.description: Reflections are organized under appropriate categories (impact_on_stakeholders, impact_on_products, impact_on_environment).

tasks.name: Develop Hierarchical Objective Breakdown
tasks.description: Create a hierarchical decomposition of objectives into sub-objectives.

completeness.description: At least one objective is broken down into multiple levels of sub-objectives.

quality.description: Sub-objectives are specific, measurable, and actionable, and complied with standards and regulations.

presentation.description: Breakdown is presented in a clear, hierarchical format.

tasks.name: Translate Objectives to Requirements
tasks.description: Develop product requirements based on chosen sub-objectives and relevant regulations.

completeness.description: At least one sub-objective is translated into specific requirements.
Relevant directives or regulations are identified and incorporated.

quality.description: Requirements are clear, specific, and aligned with both objectives and regulations.

presentation.description: Requirements are presented in a structured format, linking to relevant objectives and regulations.

step_overview.introduction: Every product has specific goals like safety, cost, and innovation, which can sometimes conflict (e.g., safety vs. cost). In this step, you'll prioritize these goals as a designer through two exercises.

reflect_on_impact.description: Consider how prioritizing certain goals affects stakeholders, the product, and the environment.

specify_and_translate_goals.description: Clearly define your goals and convert them into detailed product requirements by reviewing relevant regulations, directives, and standards.
specify_and_translate_goals.purpose: This helps ensure your design aligns with both your priorities and industry guidelines.

product_objectives.description: Manage production costs while maintaining quality
Consider how high-quality a product will be
Consider how long the lifespan of a product is
Consider the aspect of using innovative features and technologies
How easy-to-use a product will be
Examine the impact of a product on the surrounding environment
Ensure the product has a visually appealing design that attracts customers
How easy for a product can be scaled up for mass production without compromising quality
How acceptable the product can be in different countries and culture

impact_on_stakeholders: How do my priorities in objectives align with the needs and expectations of our targeted customers?
How do my priorities impact the working conditions and job satisfaction of our employees?
Are we considering the benefits and values of our suppliers?
impact_on_products: Are we compromising on quality or performance to achieve other objectives like cost efficiency? What is the impact of our choice
How my priority contribute to the succeed of the products, given the current problems of the companies, or old products?
What kind of products are we making? Does it align with the ethical values of our company?
impact_on_environment: How do my priorities support sustainable practices in product design and manufacturing?
How can society be affected from my priority?
How do my priorities shape the industry in the future?

general_process: Break it down into major components or areas.
Further divide each component into smaller, actionable tasks.

major_areas: Bike components such as braking system, frame durability, rider protection

steps: Set up channels for user feedback.
Collect and analyze data from real-world incidents.
Use insights to refine product design and safety features.
Develop clear and concise user manuals.
Include safety guidelines and best practices.

requirement_statement_format.description: Requirement statements should be formulated using the following structure:

components.name: Condition
components.description: The condition under which the function must be achieved

components.name: Constraints
components.description: The limitations or restrictions that must be adhered to while fulfilling the requirement

requirement_statement_format.example: The system [Function: shall provide real-time traffic updates] [Condition: when the user is navigating] [Constraints: without compromising battery life or data usage].
